intro: Osmorhiza mexicana, commonly known as Mexican sweetroot, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Osmorhiza mexicana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
